0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: PET brain study, To estimate beta-amyloid neuritic plaque density in patients with cognitive impairment: 370 megabecquerels (10 millicuries) IV single bolus in 10 mL or less total volume (MAX 50 mcg mass dose); begin 10-minute PET imaging 30 to 50 minutes after IV injection

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: not indicated for use in pediatric patients

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
PET brain study, To estimate beta-amyloid neuritic plaque density in patients with cognitive impairment

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• image interpretation errors, especially false negatives, have been reported; evaluate image independent of clinical information
  • radiation-emitting product; cancer risk may be increased; avoid unnecessary radiation exposure and ensure safe handling
  • report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Florbetapir F-18 is a fluorine (18) radiolabeled solution for diagnostic imaging of beta-amyloid neuritic plaque density in the brain. Florbetapir F-18 decays by emission of positron (beta+) to 0 18, which is detectable via positron emission tomography. The main photons applicable for diagnostic imaging are the coincident pair of 511 keV gamma photons

3.title: Excretion
3.mono:
• Bile: primary route
  • Fecal: primary route
  • Renal: polar metabolites

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • waterproof gloves and shielding are required for proper handling of radioactive material
  • use a short IV catheter (approximately 1.5 inches or less) to minimize contrast agent adsorption
  • begin 10-minute PET imaging 30 to 50 minutes after IV injection

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: no specific monitoring has been determined

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise female patients who are breastfeeding to use an alternate infant nutrition source, such as stored breast milk or infant formula, for 24 hours after receiving drug.
  • Side effects may include nausea, musculoskeletal pain, headache, fatigue, increased blood pressure, and injection site reaction (eg, injection site hemorrhage, irritation, or pain).
